data.title: Ear transform does not match camera transform
data.body: Fix described [here](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/138313/1#comment-859663).

data.title: libtheora fails to compile under VS2013
data.body:
Hi everybody,
I use VS2013 as IDE and I use MSBuild v12 (the one shipped with VS2013), so I converted all the projects and I compiled, without touching anything in the code.
I'm trying to compile the libtheora project from Torque3D 3.6.1, but I get 2111 errors and 158 warnings.
Most of the warnings are of the type MSB8027 and most of the errors come from syntax errors, which is quite weird since I didn't change anything.
Here's the link to download the log. Sorry, but it's too long to be pasted here or on Pastebin. Also, the log is in Italian, but I hope it's still understandable.

http://www75.zippyshare.com/v/554594/file.html

data.body:
This makes it so you can add a new module without having to modify the torque3d.cmake
Also updated the current modules by moving option code to each one.

data.title: Zip files are loaded automatically, causing confusion
data.body:
Torque treats zips transparently, so crashes have occurred when, for example, a project is zipped and left adjacent to the executable. The engine tries to execute all the scripts twice because it finds scripts in the project directory as well as the zipped version.

Not sure if this is something for us to fix ourselves, not what an appropriate solution would be. Obviously transparently treating zip files isn't a bad thing. Maybe there should be a switch to enable this behavior? Maybe stock scripts need to have less wildcard folder searches?

data.title: TSMesh::castRayRendered triangle iteration error
data.body: As noted in [this forum thread](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/129115). Apparently logged as an internal ticket but not sure if anything came of it.

data.title: TSStatic bounds collision normals seem wrong
data.body:
I did a raycast and added the following line:
DebugDrawer::get()->drawLine(rInfo.point, rInfo.point + rInfo.normal, ColorF::StockColor("Crimson"));
To render the normals of the raycast of a box:
This is the result:
![](http://imagizer.imageshack.us/a/img661/7342/1JMqQX.jpg)

This is the normals:
![](http://imagizer.imageshack.us/a/img540/6158/rkJ5R3.jpg)

Some more obscure results:
![](http://imagizer.imageshack.us/a/img661/7998/LkICpU.jpg)

Changing collision type from "bounds" to visible mesh solved the issue.

data.title: Volumetric fog region
data.body: [This resource](http://www.garagegames.com/community/blogs/view/22838) adds convex volumetric fog regions. Might be nice to make available. Discuss!

data.title: LevelInfo fog shenanigans
data.body: Reports that the LevelInfo fog was broken by [this](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/362). Re-evaluate the purpose for the change and whether it should be reverted.

data.title: Forest editor 'drop to ground'
data.body: As in [this resource](http://www.garagegames.com/community/resources/view/22293), reported [here](https://github.com/Winterleaf/OmniEngine.Net/issues/1).

data.title: Version 3.6.1
data.body: Merge the `development-3.6` branch separately into master, to avoid other changes which might have been made in `development`.

data.title: Version 3.6.1
data.body: Ready to merge changes made since version 3.6.

data.title: Fixed Full template art a bit
data.body:
Player can now swim properly, and the physical zone elevator is a bit more helpful (i.e. it sends you to the landing rather than leaving you floating in midair). Fiddled some more with PostFX settings.

Contains a temporary fix for #771, at least allowing Players to move underwater.

data.title: Bump version to 3.6.1
CMake does not name debug executables with _DEBUG

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.title: Add additional padding on unescape scenarios.  Also fix appendformat whi...
data.body:
expandEscapes was causing corruption on strings as worst case scenario was not worse enough.  

String::StrFormat::formatAppend was not using vsnprintf correctly and would corrupt when crossing allocation boundaries when appending to an existing string.

data.title: Allow CMake to generate DLL
data.body: CMake should have an option to generate the 'shared' DLL in the same way the project generator does.

data.title: Fixed minor issues with Outpost level

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body:
- Black spots caused by wrongly named images.
- HDR settings tweaked to be a bit brighter.
- Added description to level.

data.title: file name conversions for terrains ( the - character causes layers to re...
data.body: ...gister as invalid IDs, since those also double as object names)

data.body:
Redone version of #772 to fix a couple of issues.
- Empty Terrain textures
- NLF file changes
- Time of day activation

I tried to rebase to preserve authorship but git didn't seem to want to let me, sorry @Azaezel :(.

data.title: PostFX presets do not reset between missions

milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.body: Reproduce: run Full template, open Empty Terrain. Eye-hurtingly bright. Exit level and load Outpost. Grim and dark. Exit level and re-load Empty Terrain. Grim and dark. For extra fun, go into the water in Outpost and exit while submerged. Caustics everywhere.

data.title: CMake doesn't build ASM files
data.body: When used CMake generator, ASM files are added to sollution but are not used on build.

data.title: Revise Physx 2.8 actor release functions.
data.body:
Based on  `Physx 2.8 actor release fix` #689
